dict.string: PopClip is a background app that shows a pop-up action menu when the user selects text.
The consequence of denying these connections depends on the subdomain being connected to.
*.pilotmoon.com
TCP

The domain "pilotmoon.com" is owned by Nicholas Moore, the developer of PopClip. Each distinct online feature connects to a specific subdomain (such as "softwareupdate" or "crashreport") so that you can identify its purpose.
If you deny these connections, you will not be notified about new versions of PopClip.
softwareupdate.pilotmoon.com
TCP
PopClip periodically checks if a newer version of the application is available. You can disable these automatic software update checks in PopClip's settings.
If you deny these connections, PopClip's developer will not be alerted about crashes.
crashreport.pilotmoon.com
TCP
When PopClip detects that it crashed, it sends a crash report to the developer. The report contains technical details that will help the developer diagnose and fix the crash.
If you deny these connections, extensions that require an Internet connection may not work.
TCP
PopClip connects to various servers on behalf of extensions you have installed.
If you deny these connections, some extensions will not have their correct icons.
api.iconify.design
TCP
PopClip downloads icon images for some extensions from Iconify, a public open-source icon repository.
If you deny these connections, PopClip may fail to display, install or update extensions.
public.popclip.app
TCP
PopClip downloads extensions, extension updates, extension directory metadata, and extension icons from this server.
Nicholas Moore
https://www.popclip.app/
